intro: Leandra polychaeta, commonly known as the woolly leandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
